runs.comm: on the pads, Shahzad looks to tickle it around the corner. Already a noticeable decision not to give him room
worked away to midwicket, "catch it" was the call, but the fielder was a bit too deep
slipped away down leg again, that time it's quite a bit wide
jumps back and out of the line of a good length ball on middle, made his own room considering they weren't giving him any, punches into the covers

caught in front! Spin works. Just enough spin as he tosses the ball up on off stump from around the wicket, as he has been bowling so far, and gets the ball to duck back in. The batsman was going for a sweep, but hadn't got the front leg outside the line
short fine leg is extremely alert, all those leg side fielders better be, with this line of attack. Nudge off the pads doesn't amount to anything
flighted on middle and off, defended. Scattered applause from the Edinburgh crowd. That was a decent start, wasn't it?
hammered! Starts off short and although there wasn't too much room, Shahzad decides it has to go. Whips his body around as he goes for the pull and smokes it to the left of deep midwicket
top response from Evans. Pushes it up fuller to generate uncertainty. Gets the ball to straighten, since the overhead conditions allow for as much for the new ball. Gingerly defended with no footwork
back of a length and outside off, pushed to cover
camps on the back foot for a fuller ball and goes for an awful slog. This time the bat is nowhere near the ball, which stays a touch low as well outside off
loads of pace behind that. Shortish delivery just outside off, Shahzad's bottom-handed influence is very apparent as he blocks
walks across to one that's banged in, and he pulls it away to deep square leg. That time keeping to the crease works.
nice and slow on middle, Shahzad comes forward to block
great connection! Races down the pitch and puts the ball over long-on with utter disdain

moves away outside leg and away she goes! Back to back sixes. It's all well and good not giving pace to him, but when you pop the ball in the slot like that... Full-blooded swing of the arms from Shehzad as he lifts inside out over cover
that time it's a little quicker and flatter, Shahzad meets it on the full and pushes it back at the bowler

oopsy, that seems like the third six of the over. MacLeod says it is. He was tracking another Shahzad big hit at long-on, caught it quite nicely too, but he had been too close to the boundary and treads on it. Pure, brutal power
four in the over! Runs away outside leg stump to open up the off side and then holds nothing back. Violent hit down the ground and the ball crashes into the grass banks behind long-off
targets the base of off stump, driven to mid-on. Ah, normal cricket, we missed you
walks at the quickie, who doesn't like it. Bangs it in short to try and one-up the batsman. Good pace from Evans, as he hurries Stanikzai on the pull. Gets a bottom edge to the long leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, carefully defended
meets another shortish delivery on off stump and blocks. Ahhh, it's begun to rain here. The umbrellas go up, but the umpires say it's light enough to play on
short and wide, hammered away to the point boundary. Stanikzai's turn to advertise a little bit of free spirit
huge shout from Evans, but this seems to have gone down leg. Full delivery catches the batsman on the crease as he plays around his pads. Pretty good work, except for the ball missing the stumps...
back of a length on middle, clipped to deep square leg
appears a bit of a slow, short ball. Then again, he's a medium pacer. Stanikzai swivels on a pull to long leg. Nowhere near timed, though
another rising delivery on and around off stump, Stanikzai stays back and works it away with his wrists. More runs to square leg
fuller delivery with a hint of straightening. He leans forward, opens the face and finds a single towards cover. Haven't hit that spot enough, Scotland. Been too short with their quicks

punishment! The ball's been smashed into the tennis courts over point. Afghanistan's 50 is up! Too short, way too wide, and the crowd revs up with chants of "Shahzad, Shahzad, Shahzad" even as the ball disappears

ohhhh... that nearly dribbled away too! Too short from Sharif, and Shahzad is waiting for it on the back foot. Pulls hard and gets it to the left of deep square leg. Munsey races across, dives, but the ball was struck so powerfully that he nearly doesn't stop it
that seemed a touch slower than the batsman excepted. Evans has lured a hit off the splice, but it falls fell short of the short midwicket fielder. Yells in frustration
no slip, outside edge, third man's nowhere to be seen. Back of a length and outside off, Shahzad stays beside it and pokes. Finds a cheeky boundary and gets the bowler to smile wryly
full delivery on off stump, finally. Has Shahzad squared up and gets his outside edge to point.
fielder at cover dives, gets a hand on it and it helps. Shahzad shows he can still time it off the front foot. Not that he made all that much of a move. It's just his hand-eye coordination.
banged in short again, it's too easy for him right now. Goes for the hook as he manages to get under the ball and help it on its way to long leg

fuller delivery outside off, Shahzad pushes with his hands, gets an outside edge to short third man. Scotland needs to pitch a tent there and stay the night telling scary stories to each other and not caught in this little Shahzad nightmare
tossed up on off stump, defended. But it comes off the inside edge towards square leg
good length ball on middle and leg, whipped into the leg side
on the pads again. Not quite short to pull, nor quite full to lift. Drifts off Shahzad's pads to square leg. He's not happy, thought it was his fifty
flighted on middle and leg, nudged behind square leg
there it is! Another brutal fifty from Shahzad. Leans into a rather pretty cover drive. Whips his helmet off and salutes the crowd. Looks like he's saying, 'Come on, gimme more'
jumps down the ground and hammers a good length ball down the ground to long-off
goes wide of the crease and round-arms it down leg. The flick doesn't connect
tossed up and kept quite slow in front of off stump, defended
nips down the track, gets to the pitch and flicks it through midwicket
spin has just got to go! Everything looks rather matter of fact when he's batting. If the ball's tossed up, he charges and tonks it over long-on
misfield at midwicket! Pressure telling on Scotland, and it's the captain Mommsen with the butterfingers. Lots of whip in that stroke as he runs down the track and almost helicopters it away
looped up just on middle, defended
it's not just a one-man show says teh Afghani captain. Hurtles down the track and lifts the harmless looking de Lange miles over his head. Huge hit over long-on
doesn't matter if he's bowling over the wicket. He just makes his own room, again, gets under the ball, again, and lifts it way over long-on
full toss! Shahzad was making room, the bowler tries to work him out by pushing the line way outside off. But the length goes awry and allows the batsman to smear it away through point
lots slower that time, brave from Watt. And he gets it to dip enough to ruin the sweep. Only an inside edge to short fine leg
goes back to a flatter delivery on off stump and punches it to long-on
too short, and Shahzad has belted it away to the wide long-on boundary. We wonder about team scores reaching 100 inside 10 overs... Afghanistan have coasted to it
tossed up into the blockhole, Shehzad pulls out the helicopter. Hits it along the ground though to deep midwicket
offcutter at the base of off stump, Shahzad works it away straight of midwicket. That's the hundred partnership, off only 52 balls. That's an Afghanistan record for any wicket in T20Is
length and the captain has pummeled it away to the wide long-on boundary. The perfect example of a death-overs slog. And we're only in the 10th
another slower ball, this time it's right in the blockhole. Can only dig it out
keeps it full, rolls his fingers across the ball, but there is a hint of width as well. He goes for a big drive, but gets more of an inside edge
offcutter again, drilled into the covers. Keeper standing up, we might see more of those
low full toss, no prizes for guessing this was the offcutter as well. Driven to mid-off

makes the keeper earn his keep. A slower ball, yeah, but it ends up a yorker down the leg side. And Cross was blinded by the batsman as well. Could have flicked a little bit of the pad as well. But he stays low and takes it fantastically
again, this time the bowler's penalised. But if not for Cross, this would have been five wides. Length ball slides down too far. Keeper actually runs to his left to get that in
shortish and outside off, punched through the off side
good length ball on off stump, nudged into the leg side
full and slanted in on leg stump, Stanikzai falls over as he tries to flick around his front pad. Gets struck on his front pad as well
slower, short ball outside off. Stanikzai plays a controlled pull behind short fine leg
beaten outside off. Good length ball just outside off, Stanikzai doesn't move his feet all that much and pokes away from his body.

down the throat of long-on and Leask is thrilled. No hundred for Shahzad, but he's done a lion's share of the work so far. Makes his way down the track, as he has been doing against spin, and goes for a heave. Wants to clear long-on, doesn't
down the track and gets a bit too close to the tossed up ball. Squeezes it to cover

that's top work from Coetzer at short fine leg! Ran in quickly, fired a hard, flat throw to the batsman's end. Scotland are cock-a-hoop. Goes for a sweep does the new batsman Shenwari, and Stanikzai decides on a quick single. Nervous moments for both teams because the replays are so very close. It appears Scotland will be getting a double-breakthrough though. The keeper gets in between the throw and the stumps and then whirls his hand back to break the stumps. Good technique from Cross.
beats him outside off for the lack of turn. Good length ball pulls him to defend outside off
tossed up on off stump, driven calmly to long-on
drifting a bit too far down leg, and Shenwari clips it away to long leg
big appeal for leg before again as Shenwari goes for a sweep. The offspinner continues around the wicket, so I think this pitched outside leg
looks to nurdle it to leg and take a quick single.  All looks well untill Cross takes a throw atop his head and whips the bails off. Appeal made, third umpire called. All is well
down the track, but Leask has pulled his length back nicely. Can only defend
flighted just outside off, flicked away to deep midwicket
goes back to a flatter delivery and knocks it to deep midwicket. "One," he calls and one he gets as Najibullah drops his bat at the strikers'
flatter and quicker on off stump, sliced to point
saw the batsman advancing, tossed it up well wide of off stump. Najibullah though manages to reach it and crunch it away through cover
good length ball on middle and leg, worked away through midwicket
loads of wristwork there as he picks a tossed up delivery on middle and whips it to long-on
looped up outside off, smeared to cover
and it's a full toss too. Swept away to deep square leg. Didn't quite connect
driven serenely to deep cover. Pulls his length back a touch
length ball and Shenwari has swatted it away over long-on. Weird that the bat face turned on impact and he connected only off the bottom of the bat
goes back to try and clip it away, but he connects even worse. No bat, struck on the pad

makes up for it here! Runs down the track and heaves it away miles over long-on. Made him reach out because of the flight and drift, but he strikes it amazingly well. Leask is absolutely filthy with himself
flat, quick on leg stump. Pulled hard, pulled flat, and pulled straight to deep square leg. Leask sends the batsman off with a big roar.
goes back for a good length ball on middle and blocks
eesh, that held in his hand a bit too long? Or was he trying to bowl  seam up? It pitches in his own half of the pitch and the batsman pulls off the front foot to deep midwicket
starts with a slower ball on middle and leg, slid to point for a quick single
full on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket. Boy, these guys are all really strong bottom handed players
full on off stump, squeezed away to point
full toss just outside off, thumped down the ground
that's a slow full toss outside off, Nabi slogs it away to deep midwicket. "Keeper was the yell," but the fielder sends it into the bowler's end

skews away off the outside edge, but third man has fluffed it! Fielding was an issue in Scotland's last game and it follows them here. This was a good length ball that Nabi wanted to smoke over the leg side. But he had to drag it from outside off to do that. Takes a very thick outside edge, and it does swirl around in the air. Windy conditions as well. Watt was the man trying to take it, no luck. He's had a game to forget today
looks full, looks for off stump. Gets a whip to deep midwicket
room outside off, Najibullah looks to paste it over the leg side as well. Mistimes it to long-on. Could have looked to crack it over point that time
full toss outside leg stump, but that's because Nabi had made room for it. Swats it away between midwicket and long-on
lovely slower ball from Evans, but the batsman has spotted it, waits on his front foot stance with the backlift high and hammers it to deep cover
finally. He's been wishing and washing for a while, but this time it's a length ball outside off and he tucks in. Full flow of the arms as he slogs it over long-on
slower ball on middle, Najibullah goes for another swipe across the line to deep midwicket. More of the inside edge than anything
heaved over long-on! de Lange comes in and puts the ball in the slot, The batsman clears his front leg and wallops it away. Failed search for the blockhole
looped up outside off, Najibullah slaps it down the ground to long-off
tossed up and outside off, but it's so slow that Nabi is three and a half years too early with the slog
that time he's crunched it. Well, crunched enough of it to send the ball soaring over long-on
fired in on leg stump, Nabi nips down the ground and lifts it miles over long-on. This appears to be a pretty small ground for these Afghanistan big-hitters
looks for another heave to the leg side, but gets an inside edge to deep midwicket
skips down the track to and pulls a shortish delivery from well outside off to deep midwicket

full on off stump, Najib has found his timing just in time. Belts a drive down the ground. Could have taken out the bowler. Could have taken out the umpire too. Great work from umpire Brathwaite to sway to his right. Sheer power
fuller and wider outside off, slashed away to deep point
hitting against the wind as he pulls a short ball on the front foot. Deep square leg rushes in, but it drops short of him
oops! He's worried about putting the fuller ball in the batsman's reach. Fires in a yorker too far wide, the keeper gamely reaches it
this is against the wind too, and its a pretty strong one. But Nabi doesn't care. he says he's stronger. Front foot pull over deep square leg.
looks for another swipe across the line, doesn't connect and the keeper does well to get behind that again
bye bye ball! Afghanistan's first 200 in T20 cricket and it comes up in fine style. A stand and delivery heave over midwicket
fuller delivery on middle and leg, sliced away over the off side. Will this be a catch? No, beats the man in the infield and it doesn't carry to the deep
full on leg stump, whipped away to deep square leg

ah, some respite! Nabi has belted an overpitched delivery down the ground. Lots of muscle behind the ball and if not for the middle stump, the umpire would have been a goner. Then Sharif runs across, grabs the ball and uproots one of the remaining stumps. On-field umpire rules him out. Najib, who was backing up big time, appears to be out. But the fourth umpire has asked them to wait. Weird. Ball was in contact with the stumps as he pulled it out.
looks for the blockhole and finds it. Single to long-on

boom! Lobs up a full toss and Shafiquallah has got down on one-knee and heaved it over midwicket with utter disdain. Salutes the fans as he walks back. How bout that? Quite the perfect way to finish things off, considering how it started. And the largest crowd at the Grange so far has had a treat
